content:
# The error indicates that I cannot insert the remaining 8 iron ore into the furnace because it is no longer available in my inventory. 
# This suggests that the iron ore was already being processed by the furnace when I checked its inventory last.

# Currently, the furnace has 1 iron plate and 8 iron ore, and it seems to be working. 
# Since I have already inserted 5 coal, I will wait for the smelting process to complete and check the furnace's inventory again.

# I will wait for a short duration to allow the furnace to smelt the iron ore into iron plates.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait of 30 seconds
    furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)
    if furnace_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 2:  # Check if at least 2 iron plates were produced
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    print("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")  # Output message if no plates are produced

# Now, I will check the inventory of the furnace to see the iron ore and iron plates status.
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)  # Check the inventory again after waiting
print(f"Furnace Inventory: {furnace_inventory}")  # Checking what's in the furnace's inventory

# If the furnace has produced more iron plates, I can proceed to craft the assembling machine.
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")  # Inspecting the updated inventory after potential smelting
